content: In the near future, on-demand marketplaces like Swiggy, with its powerful customer base and nationwide delivery network, could spare emerging chefs the hassle and high upfront investment of launching a physical restaurant. This could open up a whole new market, drastically lowering the price of food via delivery versus food from a true restaurant. Entrepreneurial chefs could test new concepts on the cheap in standalone kitchens, with Swiggy acting as the discovery and distribution channel — a sort of app store for food.
